item.description:
1 „Éë„ÉÉ„Ç±„Éº„Ç∏„ÅÆË™≠„ÅøËæº„Åø

library(survival)
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)

2 „Éá„Éº„Çø„ÅÆË™≠„ÅøËæº„Åø

„É©„Ç§„Éï„ÅÆ„Éá„Éº„Çø

dsu01<-read_csv("
  life
  28
  30
  32
  30
  25
  27
  24
  23
  29
  29
  29
  31
  38
  33
  32
  29
  30
  18
  28
  28
  24
  23
  28
  29
  27
  26
  28
  28
  28
  27
  ",show_col_types = FALSE
)
dsu11<-count(dsu01,life) |> 
  mutate(n=n/sum(n))
plot_ly(x=dsu11$life,y=dsu11$n,type='bar')

3 „ÉØ„Ç§„Éñ„É´

3.1 Á¢∫ÁéáÂØÜÂ∫¶Èñ¢Êï∞

weibull_d<-function(m,t,eta){
  k<-(m/eta)*(t/eta)^(m-1)*exp(-1*((t/eta)^m))
  return(k)}

, „ÅÆÂ†¥Âêà

m1<-2
eta1<-15
plot(weibull_d(m1,c(1:35),eta1))

3.2 „ÉØ„Ç§„Éñ„É´ÂàÜÂ∏É„Å´Âæì„ÅÜ‰π±Êï∞

i<-rweibull(1000,shape = m1,scale = eta1)
hist(i)

„Éá„Éº„Çø„Åã„Çâ„ÉØ„Ç§„Éñ„É´„ÅÆ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„Éº„ÇíÁÆóÂá∫„Åô„ÇãÊñπÊ≥ïÔºösurvreg„Çí‰Ωø„ÅÜ„ÄÇ

t<-survreg(Surv(dsu01$life)~1, dist="weibull")

survreg„ÅÆÁµêÊûú„ÅØ„ÄÅ‰∏äËø∞„ÅÆÁ¢∫ÁéáÂØÜÂ∫¶Èñ¢Êï∞„ÅÆ„Éë„É©„É°„Éº„Çø„Éº„Å®„Åó„Å¶‰Ωø„ÅÜ„Å´„ÅØÊèõÁÆó„Åô„ÇãÂøÖË¶Å„Åå„ÅÇ„Çã„ÄÇ

1/t$scale
[1] 8.057331

exp(unname(t$coefficients))
[1] 29.57896

4 R version

R.version.string
[1] "R version 4.2.2 (2022-10-31)"

5 Python

from reliability.Fitters import Fit_Weibull_2P
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
fail_times = [
9402.7,
6082.4,
13367.2,
10644.6,
8632.0,
3043.4,
12860.2,
1034.5,
2550.9,
3637.1
]
wb = Fit_Weibull_2P(failures=fail_times)
[1m[23m[4m[49m[39mResults from Fit_Weibull_2P (95% CI):[0m
Analysis method: Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)
Optimizer: TNC
Failures / Right censored: 10/0 (0% right censored) 

Parameter  Point Estimate  Standard Error  Lower CI  Upper CI
    Alpha         7965.97         1573.53   5408.78   11732.2
     Beta         1.68128        0.444137    1.0018   2.82162 

Goodness of fit    Value
 Log-likelihood -97.1296
           AICc  199.973
            BIC  198.864
             AD   1.5487 
plt.show()

from reliability.Distributions import Weibull_Distribution
from reliability.Fitters import Fit_Weibull_3P
from reliability.Other_functions import make_right_censored_data, histogram
import matplotlib.pyplot as plt

a = 30
b = 2
g = 20
threshold=55
dist = Weibull_Distribution(alpha=a, beta=b, gamma=g) # generate a weibull distribution
raw_data = dist.random_samples(500, seed=2)  # create some data from the distribution
data = make_right_censored_data(raw_data,threshold=threshold) #right censor some of the data
print('There are', len(data.right_censored), 'right censored items.')
There are 118 right censored items.
wbf = Fit_Weibull_3P(failures=data.failures, right_censored=data.right_censored, show_probability_plot=False, print_results=False)  # fit the Weibull_3P distribution
print('Fit_Weibull_3P parameters:\nAlpha:', wbf.alpha, '\nBeta:', wbf.beta, '\nGamma', wbf.gamma)
Fit_Weibull_3P parameters:
Alpha: 28.874744956093892 
Beta: 2.029495367281646 
Gamma 20.38395851616883
histogram(raw_data,white_above=threshold) # generates the histogram using optimal bin width and shades the censored part as white
dist.PDF(label='True Distribution')  # plots the true distribution's PDF

6 „ÉØ„Ç§„Éñ„É´ÂàÜÂ∏É

import numpy as np
import plotly.express as px
def weibull_d(m,t,eta):
  k=(m/eta)*(t/eta)**(m-1)*np.exp(-1*((t/eta)**m))
  return k
m1=2
eta1=15
t1=np.arange(1,36)
d1=weibull_d(m1,t1,eta1)
fig1=px.scatter(x=t1,y=d1)
fig1

7 „Éï„Ç£„ÉÉ„Éà

from reliability.Fitters import Fit_Weibull_2P
dsu02=r.dsu01
life_max=int(max(dsu02['life']))
dsu03=dsu02['life'].values.tolist()
wb2 = Fit_Weibull_2P(failures=dsu03)
[1m[23m[4m[49m[39mResults from Fit_Weibull_2P (95% CI):[0m
Analysis method: Maximum Likelihood Estimation (MLE)
Optimizer: TNC
Failures / Right censored: 30/0 (0% right censored) 

Parameter  Point Estimate  Standard Error  Lower CI  Upper CI
    Alpha          29.579        0.709558   28.2204   31.0029
     Beta         8.05733         1.02419   6.28047   10.3369 

Goodness of fit    Value
 Log-likelihood -82.1756
           AICc  168.796
            BIC  171.154
             AD  1.48179 
print('Fit_Weibull parameters:\n Alpha(scale Œ∑):', wb2.alpha, '\nBeta(shape m):', wb2.beta)
Fit_Weibull parameters:
 Alpha(scale Œ∑): 29.578959363748456 
Beta(shape m): 8.057329129027952
import plotly.graph_objects as go
tt="Scale parameter Œ∑: "+str(round(wb2.alpha,3))+", Shape parameter m: "+str(round(wb2.beta,3))

ts=np.arange(1,life_max+1)
ta=r.dsu11
fig0201=go.Bar(
        x=ta['life'], y=ta["n"],name='Actual',
        marker={"color": "#99cc66"}
        )
fig0202=go.Scatter(
        x=ts, y=weibull_d(wb2.beta,ts,wb2.alpha), name='Weibull fit',
        line={"color": "#cc6600","width":2},
    )
fig04=go.Figure(data=[fig0201,fig0202])
fig04=fig04.update_layout(annotations=[
  go.layout.Annotation(
    xref="paper",
    yref="paper",
    x=0.03,
    y=0.95,
    showarrow=False,
    text=tt
)
])
fig04

dsu03=Weibull_Distribution(alpha=15.189, beta=2.032018)
